intro: Caulanthus divaricatus, commonly known as the Sierra bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in mountainous regions. It has basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate and stems that are often branched. Caulanthus divaricatus is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in spring and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils.
